name: WASP-130
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-130 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-130 is a star with 1.04 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.96 times its radius. It is located 587.08 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WASP-130 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-130 system


WASP-130 b

WASP-130 b was discovered by the SuperWASP-South observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-130 b is 391.14 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-130 b is 9.976 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-130 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-130, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by SuperWASP-South.
